ChunkText: students should discuss with their employer on any potential delays ahead of time. be aware of job scams! common scams are: receiving a job offer without applying, being offered the job without an interview, or sending someone money to accept the job. check the senders email address and see if it matches the domain of the company.
ContextBefore: ssn are issued by the united states social security administration ssa. to start the process, students should submit a ssn letter request in the isss portal. after a student has an I-20 with cpt approval and a receipt from the ssa, they present these documents to their employers human resources department.
ContextAfter: a simple google search will also show if the company and contacts are legitimate. reach out to the career center about any concerns.
